net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component

Class Tabs

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.ComponentImpl
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.Tabs
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Component>, LocaleContextSource, Component

    public class Tabs
extends ComponentImpl
    The Tabs displays a list of button like selections using tabs. All of the enabled selections are visible to the user to make selection quick.

    This is a simplified implementation of Tabs for use with TabbedContainerImpl.

    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com), Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • addTab

        public int addTab(TabItemDisplay display)
        Add a tab to this Tabs. The tab will be added to the end of the existing tabs. The tab will be enabled. An ID is returned that must be used to change properties for the tab later or to remove the tab. The ID will not change during the lifetime of the Tabs instance.
        Parameters:
        display - The display parameters for the tab.
        Returns:
        An integer ID for the tab that may be used later to change properties or remove the tab.

      • canReceiveFocus

        public boolean canReceiveFocus()
        Returns true. Determines if this component can receive focus. The default implementation returns false.
        Specified by:
        canReceiveFocus in interface Component
        Overrides:
        canReceiveFocus in class ComponentImpl
        Returns:
        true if this component can receive focus.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Description copied from class: ComponentImpl
        Destroy the component and release any resources. This may be called multiple times.

        This is called internally by MIWT. Do not call this method from application code.

        Overrides:
        destroy in class ComponentImpl

      • getComponentTypePrefix

        public String getComponentTypePrefix()
        Description copied from interface: Component
        Get the prefix based on the component type. This method returns an empty string.

        Overrides:

        Returns:

      • getHTMLElement

        public Element getHTMLElement()
        Description copied from interface: Component
        Get the top level elements this component will output in its current state. This should not included the entire content model.

        For example, if your code outputs the following, <p><span><b></b></span></p>, then you should only return one element that is a "p"; NOT "p, span, b".

        All configuration elements should be nested within this top element, or other arrangements should be made with the inner keeper.

        Returns:
        the element.

        public int getIdOfTabAt(int index)
        Get the ID of the tab at the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the tab.
        Returns:
        The ID of the tab.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of bounds for the current list of tabs.

      • insertTabAt

        public int insertTabAt(int index,
              TabItemDisplay display)
        Insert a tab at the given index. The tab will be enabled.
        Parameters:
        index - The index at which to insert the tab.
        display - The display parameters for the tab.
        Returns:
        An integer ID for the tab that may be used later to change properties or remove the tab.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of bounds for the current list of tabs.

      • isTabEnabled

        public boolean isTabEnabled(int id)
        Determine if a tab is enabled. A disabled tag cannot receive any user input but may still be visible.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the tab.
        Returns:
        true if the tab is enabled.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if no tab by the given ID exists.

        Throws:

      • preRenderProcess

        public void preRenderProcess(Request request,
                    Response response,
                    RendererEditorState<?> state)
        Description copied from interface: Component
        Allow the component to process any form fields before rendering. This method must be called by subclasses. Method calls on components, creating or destroying components, or nearly everything else having to do with the component tree and related data models must be done by queuing an event using EventQueue.queue(EventQueueElement). Otherwise you may get unexpected results.
        Specified by:
        preRenderProcess in interface Component
        Overrides:
        preRenderProcess in class ComponentImpl
        Parameters:
        request - the request.
        response - the response.
        state - the renderer / editor state, will be null if not using as a renderer / editor.

      • setTabEnabled

        public void setTabEnabled(int id,
                 boolean b)
        Enable or disable a tab. A disabled tab may still be visible but cannot receive input.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the tab.
        b - true to enable the tab.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if no tab by the given ID exists.
